etymologies: 1920s. From ancient Greek πλάζειν to perplex (from the same Indo-European base as classical Latin plangere to beat the breast, lament) + -o- + -lite

definitions: A calcium aluminosilicate mineral occurring as small colourless or pale yellow dodecahedral crystals with a vitreous lustre, formerly thought to be a distinct member of the garnet group, but now generally regarded as a variety of hibschite or hydrogrossular.
